author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: The Starry Night
description: Van Gogh's night sky is a field of roiling energy. Below the exploding stars, the village is a place of quiet order.

author: Frida Khalo
title: The two Fridas
description: The Two Fridas (Las dos Fridas in Spanish) is an oil painting by Mexican artist Frida Kahlo.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
title: The Last Supper
description: The Last Supper painting is a snapshot of the moment Christ tells his Apostles that one of them will betray him; “Very truly I tell you, one of you is going to betray me,” (Gospel of John 13:21).

author: Gustav Klimt
title: The Kiss
description: The painting depicts a couple embracing in a field of flowers.

author: Michelangelo
title: The Creation of Adam
description: The Creation of Adam (Italian: Creazione di Adamo) is a fresco painting by Italian artist Michelangelo, which forms part of the Sistine Chapel's ceiling.

author: Claude Monet
title: Bain a la Grenouillere
description: Bain à la Grenouillère is an 1869 painting by the French impressionist painter, Claude Monet.

author: Johannes Vermeer
title: The Little Street
description: The painting is showing a quiet street, depicts a typical aspect of the life in a Dutch Golden Age town.

author: Rembrandt
title: The Polish Rider
description: The Polish Rider is a seventeenth-century painting, usually dated to the 1650s, of a young man traveling on horseback through a murky landscape.

author: Salvador Dali
title: The Persistence of Memory
description: The Persistence of Memory is a 1931 painting by artist Salvador Dalí and one of the most recognizable works of Surrealism.
